column4: I have no problem with Cedega, since they HAVE to work in the way they do, and if not then many people would still be using Windows.
If you want a stable interface into Windows, use a processor emulator. If you want to play games choose out of the many native ones UNIX has.
I don't play games. It's just that Transgaming needs a license to legally circumvent copy protection, so therefore they have to pass that cost on
Well, they shouldn't have ripped a FOSS project, I wouldn't care if they didn't.
Either a) They don't use WINE, then there is no point doing it and many people would be without their games, or b) They do, they make their code available, then get shut down by the RIAA or whoever
No, there code was available for a while, and CVS builds should remain available but they don't release them because so many people were just grabbing the CVS
They ripped off WINE, fair and straight.
WINE developers recommend it to users, so I don't think they are too miffed
Well that's their opinion, not mine. Cedega is horrible.
I agree, that's why I don't use it. The end
The newer Skype's use ALSA or OSS, and OSS is quite fine
There is a point on making WINE x86_64, to allow people with an x86_64 OS to use it. Anyways it can be ran fine with emul-* libraries/etc no need for linux32
What I am saying is that compiling Wine for 64bit would be pointless, so just make it available like any other 32bit app on 64bit
I assure you that 90% of the problems people have with 64bit Ubuntu is not GIMP
GIMP works fine on x86_64 here?
I don't use, and never have used Ubuntu, but every application I've tried works fine here
I mean the 5% of 32bit-only apps are the cause of 90% of the problems :)
